article_title: Peugeot Secures New Loan From Chinese Bank
article_text:
French car maker PSA Peugeot Citroën may get more than a new shareholder when it completes a deal with Chinese partner Dongfeng Motor Group Co: access to a vast pool of new credit.

Peugeot, in which state-owned Dongfeng will soon own a 14% stake following a capital increase set to be completed later this year, said Wednesday that it had secured new credit lines valued at €2.7 billion ($3.71 billion) with nine banks to refinance...

twitter.description: Peugeot said it had secured new credit lines worth $3.71 billion to refinance existing loans, including one from a Chinese bank.
twitter.title: Peugeot Secures New Loan From Chinese Bank

image.alt: Peugeot says it has secured new credit lines worth $3.71 billion

twitter.creator: @Colum_M
